actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: A bill to amend the Trade Act of 1974 to promote expansion of international trade in recreational marine craft with Canada, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Recreational Marine Craft Act of 1985 - Amends the Trade Act of 1984 to authorize the President to enter into a trade agreement with Canada which shall, at a minimum, provide for the elimination of: (1) differing tariff levels on recreational marine craft between the United States and Canada; and (2) any Canadian nontariff barrier to U.S. recreational marine craft. Sets forth factors the President shall consider in negotiating such a trade agreement. Provides for staged increases in the tariff on imported Canadian recreational crafts if such a trade agreement is not made. Directs the President to consult with specified congressional committees in negotiating such agreement.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Trade Act of 1974 to promote expansion of international trade in recreational marine craft with Canada, and for other purposes.
